intro: Tribulus adscendens, commonly known as the mountain spinach or velvetleaf, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the family Zygophyllaceae and is characterized by its trifoliate leaves and yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in arid and semi-arid environments, often as a shrub or small tree. Its fruits are capsule-like structures that contain several seeds, which are dispersed by wind. Tribulus adscendens is known for its medicinal properties and has been used traditionally in herbal remedies.
